title: Prayer for Peace, Memorial Day, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, issued on May 24, 2025, declaring Memorial Day, May 26, 2025, as a day of prayer for permanent peace. It emphasizes the significance of Memorial Day as a time to honor and remember the sacrifices of fallen heroes who served the nation. The proclamation acknowledges the pain endured by Gold Star Families and expresses gratitude for their loved ones' sacrifices.

The President calls on all Americans to unite in prayer, particularly at 11:00 a.m. local time, and to observe a National Moment of Remembrance at 3:00 p.m. He also requests that flags be flown at half-staff until noon on Memorial Day to honor the deceased. The proclamation serves as a reminder of the importance of peace and the need to remember those who have served in defense of liberty.
